Description: Neck and shoulder sherd of Attic black-figured pottery lebes gamikos(?) with handle root; interior of neck black; top of wall reserved, but black below; exterior: neck black; band in added white at junction of neck and shoulder; below, left, black handle root zone; band of tongues alternating in black and red at top of shoulder; at left, framing panel, vertical palmette and lotus chain.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Venit B43 is Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology NA235, not 234.
The shape is a semi-closed one, akin to pieces taken by Beazley and Payne to be from a lebes gamikos, British Museum 1888,0601.441 and 442.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 214, no. B42) (Describes NA235)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0037) (Phase 1)
